title: Warehouse Manager Job at Tybitx Services International Limited
content:
Tybitx Services International Limited is duly registered with the Nigerian Corporate Affairs Commission, possesses Department of Petroleum Resources (DPR) permits in the provision of Recruitment services/manpower supply & management and Training/manpower development for the oil and gas industries. Our aim is to support our clients to focus on their core business by taking on the search for employees that meet their strategic goals and aspirations.

We are recruiting to fill the position below:

Job Position: Warehouse Manager

Job Location: Kirikiri, Lagos
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Description
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	The Warehouse Manager is responsible for the day-to-day operations of a warehouse.
	He/She oversees the receiving, storing, and shipping of goods and materials.
	The Warehouse Manager ensures that all warehouse activities are carried out in a safe, efficient, and accurate manner.


Duties & Responsibilities


	Oversee the physical storage and retrieval, and distribution of products in the warehouse.
	Oversee the maintenance and repair of equipment and ensure that all systems, equipment and vehicles are functioning properly.
	Works with the Operations Manager to develop strategies for improving distribution and customer service.
	Setting up layout and ensuring efficient space utilisation.
	Produce reports and statistics regularly (IN/OUT status report, dead stock report etc).
	Receive feedback and monitor the quality of services provided.
	Implementing and overseeing security operations.
	Maintain standards of health and safety, hygiene and security.
	Manage stock control and reconcile with data storage systems.
	Plan work rotas, assign tasks appropriately and appraise results.
	Maintaining documentation and keeping accurate records of warehouse activities.
	Recruit, select, orient, coach and motivate employees in conjunction with the Operations Officer and the HR Business Partner.


Requirements


	Minimum of First degree in relevant discipline.
	Minimum experience of 2-3 years of experience in warehouse management.
	Strong knowledge of warehousing Key Performance Indicators (KPIs).
	Hands-on experience with warehouse management software and databases.
	Proficient knowledge of inventory and inventory controls.
	Must reside within Kirikiri and its environ.


Salary
N95,000 Monthly.

title: Job Vacancies at Solution Impact Global Resources
content:
Solution Impact Global Resources - Our client, a renowned multi-specialty one-stop healthcare provider is recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Medical Laboratory Technician

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary


	The successful candidate will assist in laboratory procedures, conduct diagnostic tests, and ensure the accuracy of medical results to support patient care.


Key Responsibilities
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	Collect and prepare samples for laboratory testing.
	Perform routine medical tests under the supervision of a Medical Laboratory Scientist.
	Ensure proper handling and storage of laboratory specimens.
	Maintain laboratory equipment and follow safety protocols.
	Assist in record-keeping and documentation of test results.


Requirements


	Diploma or certification in Medical Laboratory Technology.
	Valid practicing license from the Medical Laboratory Science Council of Nigeria (MLSCN).
	Minimum of [Insert required years] years of experience in a clinical or hospital laboratory.
	Strong attention to detail and ability to follow laboratory protocols.
	Good communication and teamwork skills.


Application Closing Date: 10th July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: solutionimpactglobalresources@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Medical Officer 

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
Slot: 7 Openings

Responsibilities


	Conduct routine check-ups to patients to assess their health condition and discover possible issues.
	Maintain accurate and detailed patient records.
	Provide health and wellness advice to patients, including diet, physical activity, and hygiene.
	Diagnose and treat illnesses, medical conditions, and injuries.
	Prescribe medications and provide detailed instructions for administration.
	Perform minor surgical procedures.
	Collaborate with other healthcare professionals to ensure comprehensive patient care.
	Stay updated with medical advancements and attend professional development sessions.
	Ensure compliance with healthcare regulations and safety standards.


Requirements


	MBBS and MDCN Certificates.
	At least 1 year of post NYSC experience in a hospital.
	Current practising license.


Benefits


	Competitive Salary (N450,000 - N600,000/ month).
	Free Accommodation
	Additional Bonuses.


Application Closing Date: 2nd July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: solutionimpactglobalresources@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

3.) Staff Nurse / Midwife

Job Location: Ibadan, Oyo
Employment Type: Full-time
Slot: 7 Openings

Responsibilities


	General patient care and management.
	Maternal and neonatal care.


Requirements


	Nursing and Midwifery Qualifications.
	At least 2 years of post-midwifery qualification experience in a hospital.
	Current Practicing license.


Application Closing Date: 3rd July, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should forward their CV to: solutionimpactglobalresources@gmail.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

title: Job Openings at Fastizers Food and Confectionery Limited
content:
Fastizers Food and Confectionery Limited started with its first production of cookies in the year 2010, desiring to cater to its immediate community. This first batch of home-made Fastizers Cookies, produced with less than N1,000, got so much positive feedback it inspired the production of subsequent batches, however still on a small scale from a home-kitchen.

We are recruiting to fill the following positions below:

1.) Payable Accountant

Job Location: Agbara, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Job Summary
     

        


     (adsbygoogle = window.adsbygoogle || []).push({});
    
    




	To provide financial and administrative support by ensuring the company makes payment for goods and services received and properly record transactions by posting receipts.


Qualifications


	Should be willing to work from Agbara.
	Knowledge of basic accounting principles.
	Working knowledge of financial software and MS Office.
	Perform day-to-day financial transactions, including verifying, classifying, and recording accounts payable data
	Reconcile the accounts payable ledger to ensure that all bills and payments are accounted for and properly posted
	Verify and investigate discrepancies, if any, by reconciling vendor accounts and monthly vendor statements
	Reconciliation of GRNI, Trade Account Payable GL Balances and Vendors advance payment and submission of a weekly/monthly report on these activities.
	Generate reports detailing accounts payables status
	Understand expense accounts and cost centers
	Posting of Month-end Closing Journals for - Accruals, Prepayments, Amortization etc
	Provide supporting documentation for audits
	Proficient in Microsoft office tools.


Salary
N150,000 - N180,000 Monthly. 

Application Closing Date: 20th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: Careers@fastizers.com using the Job Position as the subject of the email.

 

 

2.) Flow Wrap Machine Operator

Job Location:  Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Key Responsibilities


	Operate and monitor food processing or packaging machinery.
	Ensure machines are properly set up for production runs.
	Carry out regular cleaning and maintenance of equipment.
	Accurately complete production logs and reports.
	Collaborate with other team members to meet daily production targets.
	Detect and report mechanical faults or malfunctions.
	Ensure compliance with company safety, hygiene, and quality standards.
	Set up machine/equipment for operation.
	Start machine/equipment and make adjustments to machine when necessary to improve performance.
	Ensure all processes are done under strictGood Manufacturing Practices (GMP).


Requirements


	Minimum of SSCE/OND/Technical Certificate or its equivalent.
	At least 1–2 years of relevant experience in a manufacturing/FMCG environment.
	Basic understanding of mechanical operations and machine maintenance.
	Good attention to detail and strong problem-solving skills.
	Willingness to work shifts, or extended hours if required.
	Good Communication Skill, Attention to details, Analytical and numerical skills i.e. ability to perform basic mathematical calculations.


Application Closing Date: 24th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their CV and Cover Letter to: Careers@fastizers.com using “Flow Wrap Machine Operator” as the subject of the email.

 

 

3.) Production Supervisor

Job Location: Agbara, Ogun
Employment Type: Full-time

Responsibilities


	Effectively manage resources required for production to meet targets and timelines.
	Ensure adequate numbers of factory hands are available and confirmed for production.
	Coordinate maintenance activities for production equipment and machinery.
	Supervise production processes, allocating resources as needed to meet targets.
	Provide accurate production data to management to develop performance targets.
	Develop and manage production checklists to cover all key resources and SOPs.
	Ensure production starts on time unless unavoidable delays arise.
	Propose continuous improvement strategies for production processes.
	Report on work plans, resourcing, challenges, maintenance, and downtimes to the Production Manager.
	Ensure smooth handovers of assignments or supervisory duties when necessary.
	Ensure punctuality and commitment to scheduled production activities.
	Oversee effective cleaning and orderliness in all production areas, maintaining proper segregation.
	Adhere strictly to health and safety guidelines at workstations.
	Ensure timely and accurate filing of records, maintaining organized and accessible documentation for analysis and reference.
	Interpret and enforce company policies and procedures, consulting superiors or relevant departments where necessary.


Requirements


	Bachelor’s Degree / HND in Food Science or related fields.
	At least 2 years of professional or industry experience in production supervision.
	Proficiency in Microsoft Office applications.
	Strong communication and leadership abilities.
	Experience with production equipment and capacity planning.
	Excellent planning, analytical, and organizational skills.
	Ability to work based on the factory's production schedule.
	Proximity to Agbara,Ogun State will be an added advantage.


Salary
N120,000 - N150,000 / month.

Application Closing Date: 20th June, 2025.

Method of Application
Interested and qualified candidates should send their recent CV to: careers@fastizers.com using the Job Position as the subject of the mail.

title: Project Manager - Interior Design Job at People Capacity Management

We are committed to meeting the needs of our clients in a timely and cost-effective manner. Our goal is to offer our clients the option that best suits their needs, be it a short or long-term assignment or on a project or ad hoc basis. We take the time to develop strong working relationships with our clients by understanding their business, their needs, and the company culture.
